dict.string: Gerard E. Moss was held in Dachau for three and a half weeks. He went to Israel after Kristallnacht with the UK Army Royal Engineers. When he came to the United States, he became a CPA.

In 1935, Charlotte Hirsch Garfield’s father was told he could not practice as a pharmacist any more. In 1938, she had to leave school. Her father decided to leave Hamburg, Germany, and the family came to New York by ship in September 1938. In October, Kristallnacht took place.

Ralph Dolton was born in Germany in 1922. He went to Shanghai, China, in 1938. Just before Kristallnacht, his father’s clothing store was robbed. His mother, father, and sister went to a place where they were getting Jews out. After a month in Italy, they got tickets for Shanghai where they lived for seven years, and then they then came to the United States.
Shelia Marcus was born in Hanover, Germany, the year after the war. Her parents were survivors of the Holocaust.
Susan Bergman was a child survivor. Her mother was in Dachau, and her father was in another camp.
William Bernheim worked in the Lodz ammunition factory for five years. He survived Buchenwald. Today, he is a famous artist.

Lya Quitt (Haberman) was born in Berlin in 1928. She was caught by Germans and told the soldiers that she spoke five languages. The Catholic church in Florence, Italy, saved her, and she went from Italy to Palestine in 1944 where she got married. She came to the United States when her husband became ill. She is mentioned in the book Holocaust Odyssey.
